result.execSummary:
The defendant William E Lemmon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

10:08 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Seth Feldner present in court.  Court goes over defendant's cases, defendant has already had one extension on each of these cases.  Statement by defendant.  Court questions defendant regarding payments.  Statement by defendant, can pay off the $43 by 07/05.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year on each case.  In 15CM167 if not paid by 07/05, defendant to spend 30 days in county jail.  On 14CM199 - Court orders defendant to pay $100.00 per month or to serve the 10 days in jail for each month he does not pay. 

Court adjourned at 10:15 a.m.
Probation review hearing on June 18, 2019 at 10:00 am.

3:01 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Cour goes over the last probation review hearing held, the defendant was working.  Court informs the defendant that the Court extended the defendant's probation for a period of one year for non-payment of court obligations.  Court instructs the defendant that the court found the defendant has not made a good faith effort.  Court informs the defendant that if probation needs to be extended again, the Court will fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 3:02 p.m.
Probation review hearing on June 27, 2017 at 02:45 pm.

Warrant has been cancelled - talked with Sue at GLSO.
43

2:46 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - are prepared to resolved these matters.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 on 2014CM199 & count 1 on 2015CM167.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged on 2014CM199.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged on 2015CM167 and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2014CM199 (DC)

90 days county jail stayed, and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Domestic Violence Assessment.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

2015CM167

6 months county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

Court quashes the warrants.

Court adjourned at 2:57 p.m.
